greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) is the number of permutations on n elements with at least one k-cycle for 1 <= k <= n.
comment: T(n,k) is equivalent to n! minus the number of permutations on n elements with zero k-cycles (sequence A122974).
link: Dennis P. Walsh, The number of permutations with no k-cycles
formula: E.g.f. of column k: (1-exp(-x^k/k))/(1-x). - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 11 2017
mathematica: Table[n!*Sum[(-1)^(j + 1)*(1/k)^j/j!, {j, Floor[n/k]}], {n, 10}, {k, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 02 2017 *)
results.author: _Dennis P. Walsh_, Oct 02 2017
